text: that's social grooming the way one
Japanese macaque is combing through the
fur of the other one it could also be
called nitpicking NIT says in the eggs
of lights mmm that's a good one the more
social contacts you have the more
grooming you get the more grooming you
get the fewer lights that may not seem
surprising but close physical contact
can also spread lice from one monkey to
another so researchers at Kyoto
University in Japan decided to test if
having all those friends was really
worth it they observed social networks
of female macaques to see who had the
most lice in winter mating season and
summer birthing season the females with
the most contacts had fewer lice in
spring and summer numbers of social
contacts did not affect louse numbers
for reasons that aren't clear yet what
is clear is that being social is good
for macaques even if your pals have
lights
